Reviews.Title: Good picts, poor quality, annoying operation
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I have to say this before anything else - this is a $100 camera.  You get what you pay for.The good:It's 10M PixelsIt's $100.Takes nice pictures (in good light).AA batteries.Fits in my hand very well.The "Auto" mode makes it easy.The bad:Cheap construction (to the point of damaging Canon's reputation of quality products in my opinion).No image stabilization (but....  it is a $100 camera...)**"Charging the flash"...  This is an approx 5-10 second delay every time you want to take a picture.  It may not sound like that much time, but it gets real annoying real quick.Bottom line:It takes pictures.  It takes nice pictures.  They get a little grainy and colors get a little off at low light.  But in good light, it makes good picts.  But the delay between pictures, mostly from the "Charging the flash" message, is just too much of an annoyance for me.  Which is a shame, because this is a decent little camera otherwise.  But, it's annoying enough that I wouldn't recommend purchasing this camera (unless your patiences exceeds mine).

Reviews.Title: No real difference between A480 and A490 - other than $10
Reviews.Author: Stephen Dupre
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review on the little brother model A480 - a good camera (if used with ample lighting).  If you look at the specs carefully, there is really nothing to distinguish this camera (A490) from the A480 to a novice or beginner.I had them both side-by-side and also reviewed their specs side-by-side.Proso Truly a fit-in-the-pocket camerao AA batteries and good battery lifeo Good pictures in decent lightingConso Build quality not great.  *VERY* light and cheap plastic.  Cameras from just 2 years ago put this to shame.o Somewhat price. Save the $10 and buy the A480 if you like this style.  These camera often fluctuate $20 at a timeo The camera isn't as well made as prior Canon's in this price range - though it is up on features.o Not so good in low-light conditionsThere is no image stabilization in this camera so low-light photos will be blurry in some cases - be careful of lighting..Overall a good beginners camera but be ready to upgrade - especially if you drop it hard.There are a lot of minor cons listed here, but you get a lot for a $100 10MP beginners camera like this as long as you don't shoot in low-light.

Reviews.Title: a fine pocket-able point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Te - Saw
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera several weeks ago after my six year old Pentax Optio 30 was accidentally damaged. I held off on writing a product review until I learned all the features and got comfortable with navigating the menus. I can confidently say this camera is a great value in a reasonable price range.Pros:- Good picture quality under most conditions in Auto mode.- Great pictures under all conditions if you make use of the many features this camera has to offer.- Uses AA batteries.- Quality materials/build.Useful features everyone should want:- Auto, Scene-based and Program modes- Program mode offers adjustable ISO speed (80 - 1600), white balance, color saturation, sepia tone or black and white, metering, single shot or continuous frames- decent video with reasonably high definition- Normal focus range, plus infinity and macro- Exposure control +/- 2 stops- Playback mode while camera is off and lens is retracted- better than average flash includes slow synchro mode and has adjustable flash exposureCons (no fault with this particular camera - these are general observations):- Short battery life if flash is used often with standard alakalines.(No problem. Buy a four-pack of Powerex 2700 rechargeables. I've been using them for years. Each charge lasts the equivalent of 3-4 pairs of throw-aways! And in a pinch, where CAN'T you buy standard AAs?)- Could benefit from better ergo design.(Why do manufactures pay such minimal attention to grip-ability of small electronics? Of course, if they made things too grip-able, we'd rarely drop them, and they'd sell less replacements...)Anyway, ignore negative reviews written by the impatient and the uninformed. This is a fine, feature-packed compact camera, and it's easy to recommend at under $100.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality very simple to use and low price
Reviews.Author: Maria Resurreccion
Reviews.Content: I just read the 1 review for this camera and it isn't really a review. They complained that there was no memory card and then doesn't even describe the performance of this camera. I just bought this camera and it is so easy to use, it also has great picture quality. When you are not using it then it automatically powers off saving the life of the battery.  This is a great deal and I haven't seen many cameras come with a memory card unless it is being sold in a bundle or an online special. You can't rate the quality of a product by what accessories it didn't come with.

Reviews.Title: Great entry level camera!
Reviews.Author: Nick Holls
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera as a gift for my mother-in-law. She loves to take pictures but still uses the disposable cameras. This camera here is ideal for someone who has never useda digital camera before. My mother-in-law has had no problem adjusting to using this camera, and has stopped buying the disposable cameras. It has been very simple to use. The picture quality exceeds my expectations for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Philip Hughes "hi2u"
Reviews.Content: Got this for my 73 YO mother and it is awesome. Easy and non complicated to operate. uses 2 AA batteries so nothing to worry about. I recommend this camera for everyone.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A490
Reviews.Author: C. Streeter "picture taker"
Reviews.Content: I was able to take good pictures right out of the box. They are clear.The camera goes from light to dark conditions very well for great pictures in any light.I am very happy with it and would recommend it to anyone who wants asmall digital camera that is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: VangieGirl
Reviews.Content: Consumer Reports recommended this camera. I got it for $80. It takes great pictures and is easy to use. CR compared it to a $350 camera and said that this camera's pictures were just as good. This is a great buy for someone who is looking for a simple camera to take clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good value, small package - Takes nice pictures.
Reviews.Author: MaineGeekGirl
Reviews.Content: The Cannon Powershot A490 works well. If you are looking for a simple point and click this is it. The camera even beeps at you to let you know that your shot is in focus. There are additional features which can be used if you wish, such as time delayed, movies and zoom up to 13x.The camera fits easily into a shirt pocket. The extra features are indicated by graphics on small buttons that are fairly easy to identify.I found the included software a bit cumbersome, but if you take your time you can adapt to it. The camera itself does not have any internal picture capability - so you do need to purchase the card as well as the batteries to make the camera take the pictures. There is no case included. Reading the manual before taking pictures would be helpful.

Reviews.Title: Pleased for the price I paid!
Reviews.Author: AGnagmeoln
Reviews.Content: The Canon A490 has been a pleasure to get to use.  For a camera under $90.00, the image quality is good and the video quality holds its own as well.The camera's image quality varies.  The image quality is much better outdoors than indoors.  Outside the camera takes fairly high quality pictures.  Macro shots are excellent and portraits are very great as well.  The image quality indoors is still good for an entry level camera but does tend to get grainier (as expected) when there is little light.  The screen displays a much grainier picture indoors than what it actually takes which turns out to be a nice surprise.The flash indoors is essentially useless.  It tends to wash everything out and overall just isn't worth having on.  I'd save the battery and just hold your hand still and you should get enough light to take a decent picture.I was very impressed with the video on the camera.  This was one of the main points when it came to choosing this camera.  The video isn't ready for the big screen but at 480x640, it's good enough to record events of all types.  Again, the video is much better outside than inside.  The camera also has no limit on how long it will record video for.  If you have an 8GB card, it can record 8GB without having to record in portions.  You must use the software provided to convert the raw video into a format that regular programs such as Window's Media Player, can preview them.The modes are somewhat helpful.  I tend to stay on soley auto mode which is what these entry level cameras are really made for.  Action shots (outdoors) turn out surprisingly quite well!The camera's 2.5 inch screen is big enough to preview the pictures you've taken comfortably but I would still recommend seeing them on your monitor.  The camera comes with a lot of software; although, it is aimed more for beginners.  The battery life isn't great with cheap batteries or the ones provided.  I'd recommend going out and spending $10.00 on a double A battery charger so the hassle of constantly buying more batteries is eliminated.Overall I am very pleased with this camera.  My ratings are only applicable in comparison to other point and shoot cameras in this price range.  The quality doesn't stand up to a DSLR but it makes for an amazing starter camera or a camera for an aging relative who isn't interested in all the bells and whistles!

Reviews.Title: Very nice, lightweight camera
Reviews.Author: Laura E. Price
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera elsewhere (Walmart) for $79.00; it is easy to use (even with access to the detail functions) and very lightweight, so it won't weigh down your wrist when you tote it around.  It takes good video with sound, and upon playback on the camera itself you can hear the sound quite clearly!  The installation of drivers and software on Windows Vista was easy and painless, and the one-year replacement is cheap ($6.00 at Walmart).  Picture quality as also very good!  I recommend this camera for anyone new to using digital cameras.  The only issue I had with learning to use the camera was the focus function, but once you figure out the light touch needed, it's a breeze.

Reviews.Title: Another Two-Year Camera
Reviews.Author: Jet "jet2213"
Reviews.Content: I just bought this at Staples for $99 because I needed a camera right away to photograph job sites for work as my previous camera stopped working.  For $68 at Amazon, I'll probably buy another as a backup after this one inevitably breaks.I'm on my third Canon point-and-shoot in five years.  I guess I buy Canons out of brand loyalty after owning a wonderful AE-1 for 20 years.  I just need something cheap to take pics for work or the occasional family/friends party picture.  These cheap Canons aren't built to last more than a year or two.  I previously had a Powershot A70 and Powershot A580 and both lasted two years before breaking down.This new A490 is missing a few of the features I got used to with my previous cameras.  One is the lack of a viewfinder.  While the view screen is convenient enough, I was taking pictures of goats in a pen at a farm and the way the sun was reflecting, I couldn't see that the camera was auto-focusing on the fence wires in the foreground instead of the goats.  So I got pics of sharp fence wires and blurry goats.Another thing its lacking which its predecessors had is an ergonomic design that allowed it to be gripped easily with the right hand.  This camera is thinner and flat across, and it won't be long before I drop it.  Better have a solid carrying case too.Also the different shooting modes aren't accessible by a spinning dial on top of the camera as on my previous Powershots.  You have to go in to the menu to access the various modes aside from Auto.I did pay less for this than I did for my previous Powershots so its no surprise the features are lesser.EDIT:  I CHANGED THE REVIEW FROM THREE TO ONE STAR NOW THAT I'VE HAD A CHANCE TO USE THE CAMERA FOR A WHILE.  THE BATTERY LIFE IS RIDICULOUSLY SHORT, SHORTER THAN EITHER OF THE TWO PREVIOUS CANONS I MENTIONED.  GLAD I DIDN'T BUY THE EXTRA CAMERA YET; I'M GOING TO LOOK FOR SOMETHING ELSE INSTEAD...

Reviews.Title: Do not expect this camera to deliver DSLR-like output
Reviews.Author: Rocket Scientist
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with gold box deal for only $49. For that price, this is quite good camera. However, it has some weak points, you have to consider before buying. For reference, I'll be comparing this camera to my 5 year old Fujifilm Z5FD.UPDATE 27.06.2011: I've used 2pcs 2700mah rechargeables with this camera, and total amount of pictures taken equals to 430 shots, including 10 minute of video and about 5 minutes of picture reviewing. So, battery life is excellent! Don't be fooled by battery low indicator flashing - it started to flash at about 180th shot, but I took more than 220 shots afterwards!1. Poor battery life. A pair of good quality alkalines (included ones), lasted only for 136 shots. I can estimate, that with good NiMH's you'll get maybe 160 shots. Fujifilm lasts for about 220 shots, while having battery twice less in power than Canon.2. Slow general responsiveness, slow AF, slow flash recycling. I put two these cameras side by side, and pressed shutter button on both of them same time. While fuji already saved picture and was ready for the next shot, canon was still saving the picture!3. Acidness of colors. Camera not only oversaturates colors, but also gives them acid look. For example, sky will look more cyan, than blue.4. AWB errors. If there's some quite large, colored object in frame, AWB will give whole picture it's color tint. For example, if taking photo of large red baloon in front of white wall, you'll notice that whole picture will have pink tint.5. Some settings aren't saved upon exit. For example, there are several viewing modes, where you can see various degree of information about the taken image. The setting "detailed view" will be reset on "normal", after you zoom in or out, so need to change it every time. Very annoying.6. Low resolution, sluggish screen. Refresh rate of screen is about 25fps I can guess. Fujifilm provides 60 fps, and this gives the HUGE difference in actual life. Literally saying, on fuji, what you see on screen, is what you capture, on canon, you always get delay.7. Flimsy battery compartment door. Each time I close it, I got feeling that this is the last time, and it going to fail next time.These were main cons. Now let's list the Pro's of this camera against my old fujifilm (and possibly, your older digicam, which you're planning to replace with this canon).1. More precise AF. Thanks to AF assist lamp and newer engine, this camera provides better AF capabilities. Difference is not huge, but still noticeable. Say, from 100 pictures taken with both camera, about 32 taken with fuji will be out from focus, and only 21 taken by canon will be out of focus.2. Automatic mode switching works like a charm, most times you don't need to touch any setting, camera will detect required mode automatically and switch it. Very handy for beginners and point & shooters.3. AA batteries are great. While it does not lasts that long on AA batteries, they are available anywhere.4. High speed USB 2.0. Most older cameras have slow USB connection, so transfer of 1GB of photos (that not that much, about 300 images), will take up to 20 minutes. This camera provides high speed USB connection, so in 2-3 minutes you'll be done.Overall, this is very good and feature packed camera, considering it's price. I know it won't last me for ages, but hey, its only 49 bucks, who cares?

Reviews.Title: Good if your expectations are appropriate.
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews for this camera, and shake my head wondering what people thought they were ordering.  Didn't they notice that this is the cheapest camera in Canon's lineup?  Didn't they notice, the no-frills spec list?  Instead, they complain that it is not the fastest camera with the most features and most superb handling.  It's like complaining that your Toyota Yaris is not up to par with the Lexus your neighbor has.FOr me, this is a nice no-frills camera.  It reminds of what a good mid-range $200 camera would have been 3 years ago.  The lens is not wide angle, the zoom range is short, there are not 15,000 scene modes, etc.  It's just a good basic camera that has good picture quality in good light, or with flash.  Just like you'd expect from a basic point and shoot.  It is a little chunky if you are used to the slim models like the Canon SD1300/1400, but it is still pocketable.I'd recommend it for anyone that wants something very basic with good picture potential, or something so cheap you can give it to a young kid.

Reviews.Title: Compact and Lightweight
Reviews.Author: Simon
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced a ten year old Fuji digital camera and is significantly smaller and lighter.  The weight of the camera can give the impression of flimsiness but really the materials appear appropriate for the purpose.  Picture quality is more than adequate for my purposes, even in poor light when it easily outperforms my old camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A490
Reviews.Author: CarolB
Reviews.Content: So far, we're happy with this camera.  It does not come with a card, so be prepared for that.It is small and has a handy little carrying case; more lightweight than our previous Canons.And the pictures have been fine.

Reviews.Title: need steady hand
Reviews.Author: Gadget fan
Reviews.Content: It is great camera for the price. Easy to use, captures very nice pictures outdoor. Low light pictures are little bit grainy and you need to hold camera steady. Since it is light weight camera it is difficult to hold it steady. Some time pictures are very good, bright and sharp (compared to DSLR result) but thats based on your luck. I still recommend this if budget is main concern

Reviews.Title: Canon A490 a Good Choice
Reviews.Author: Jimmy
Reviews.Content: This was a great gift item for a family member who wanted a compact camera that took quality pictures.  The price is also a plus.  We are very satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: Canon A490
Reviews.Author: Papa "Tom"
Reviews.Content: Satisfied. Bought as pocket camera which could be easily carried at all times. Need to have fastest memory cardto get satisfactory performance.  Wish it had more optical zoom like my CANON SX110, but the smaller size and lighter weight make the CANON A490 an acceptable substitute.

Reviews.Title: vacation shots
Reviews.Author: C. George "women forester"
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for a trip to the Grand Canyon.  Camera is easy to use and takes great pictures.  The only complaint you cannot see the picture prior to snapping the shot on a sunny day, was afraid shots would turn out bad but after downloading pitures they all turned out great.  Would prefer an eye piece to center shots.

Reviews.Title: Within 4 months it won't keep the date
Reviews.Author: Holly Leshinsky
Reviews.Content: Got a great price on the camera, but within 4 months, it won't keep the date correctly; constantly needs to be reset & then doesn't count it correctly when it does hold for a day.  Make mananging photos a huge hassle.  Eats thru the AA's.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera with just a couple of issues
Reviews.Author: Jody
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer, and can't be bothered to learn the ins and outs of a complicated piece of equipment. This little Canon is perfect for me. It's small enough to tote everywhere, it's basically point and shoot, and it's easy to download the pictures.I'll describe the drawbacks that keep it from being 5 star across the board, but please bear in mind that in all other areas, this camera is just great.The on button and the picture button are very close together. It's getting better, but sometimes I still turn the camera off when I meant to snap a picture.Sometimes the camera is slow to focus, especially when snapping a series of pictures, and the flash takes a few seconds to recharge.The battery life is fabulous and I love that it doesn't use the fancy shmancy batteries that are such a headache when traveling.  This little Canon is user friendly to the max. and perfect for travel.I considered buying a case for it, but since it's compact enough to pop in a pocket in my purse, I really don't see the need. When the camera is off, the lense is well protected, and it's hard to turn on by accident. (I don't know why it's so easy to turn off, but that's better than the other way around)I highly recommend this camera for the photographer who wants a highly portable way of preserving a moment.

Reviews.Title: My iPhone is Better
Reviews.Author: Paper Gangsta
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera this summer to have something besides my iPhone to take pictures with. I did a lot of research, because I wanted an okay camera that I could tote around to the festivals and concerts I was going to. I probably know slightly-above-average compared to your typical camera users when it comes to cameras, so I wasn't expecting much. I just wanted something basic.I don't have much to say about this camera, because I hardly used it. I've got an iPhone 4, and while the phone is harder to point-and-shoot and doesn't come with a carrying handle (although I'm sure they're out there), the quality of the photos was so much better. I used this camera a total of maybe 20 photos before going back to just using my iPhone.If you're looking for a very basic, under $100 camera with awful zoom but decent MP, this should be fine. If you've got a newer iPhone, especially one with video, invest in a decent case with a strap. You'll come out a lot cheaper and with higher-quality photos... and better zoom.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, Exceptional, Awesome. EXACTLY what wanted.
Reviews.Author: John T. Kooz "Validate Your Life"
Reviews.Content: IT IS MARVELOUS it was amazingly $60 on amazon (from another seller) got it used.  it's in excellent condition.  The interface is familiar from the canon cameras I've owned (3 of them the past 8 years) this is the 4th, the least expensive, but the highest MP, 10!!! MARVELOUS  I like this much better than any other canon camera I've owned.  It is simple and marvelous.  5/5 Stars. Apex-Productivity item.  Sharp photos.  GREAT video recording, too!! WOW marvelous!!!! And uses AA, infinitely better than a charger!!! It fits perfectly in a leather-safe pocket container.  I popped in a micro_Sd_16GB in a sd_adapter and it works magnificently.  The max on previous canon cameras I had was around 4GB, so I (with the nifty sd adapter trick) have 4 times as much storage space and flexibility of microsd AND it uses AA battery so I never need to haul around the charger (ideal because I have tons of rechargeable batteries).  This superbly fits in with micro_sd. Pocket in a container that I use.  Rechargeable batteries. Durable. magnificent size.  Totally rocks. (I really needed a replacement to photo thousands of items, documents, and for normal use, and occasional vid). Outrageously awesome price and superb (easily teh best I've owned) camera.

Reviews.Title: Works better than you would expect for a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Brain Byte
Reviews.Content: I enjoy photography.  I'm not the type to have cameras that cost $,$$$ because I am a broke college student, not that I don't want one.  When my last camera broke while on vacation (yeah, not such a happy thing) I found myself in the market for a new one prior to a school trip to Europe.  I didn't want a camera that would attract a lot of attention as I toured, but I wanted something that would take a decent shot, oh, and something that wouldn't break the bank.My brother has this camera, and so when I found it for such a good price on amazon I went ahead and bought it.  This isn't a fancy camera, so don't expect it to be.  That said, it takes excellent pictures for what it is, and I would say, better than what I would expect, especially for the price.  I had used my brothers camera before and found it very simple, and got some good shots with it.  My own A490 was no different.  I took LOTS of pictures with this little camera and they turn out marvelously. Sometimes if I move the camera to soon or if the lighting is especially odd the picture isn't great, but usually all that is needed is a slightly different angle and me not whipping the camera about to look at the shot I just took.Notes:Small enough to stick in my pocket, and not so flashy its likely to get stolenTakes good pictures for what it is.  I've had lots of people comment on the quality of photographs taken on this little cameraI used to have a nicer cannon, and so the difference in options was at first a little disheartening, but I figured out how to get by just fine with what the A490 offers.Sometimes it takes a little long to come back to life after taking a picture (because of the flash charge and processing time) but I have been able to get around this by partially depressing the "take" button.I left this at 4 stars because I don't always trust a 5 star review (because I think they are biased).  Overall this is a very good little camera.  Don't expect it to be more than it is, and you will be pleasantly surprised and please with its performance.** As a note, when I purchased this product it was $60  I just noticed that it has gone up, so be sure to shop around.

Reviews.Title: Easy for the parents
Reviews.Author: Ruth
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my parents as a present and despite their typical aggravation with unfamiliar technology, this camera has been a hit so far and they seem to be learning how to use it well.

Reviews.Title: So Easy to Operate
Reviews.Author: Mary in Texas
Reviews.Content: We gave this camera to our 5 year old grandson since we thought the "toy" camera made for his age was too immature for his abilities.  We were right to give him this one.  He has taken some fantastic pictures and he is able to use it with ease.  Batteries needed to be replaced rather soon, but all in all, it is a great little camera for the price.  If a 5 year old can use it, anyone can.

Reviews.Title: Not worth retail value
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: I got this camera when Amazon had it for $50. For $50, it got the job done. Overall, it feels very cheaply built, and the pictures are not that great quality. Even though it has the MP's, it's the sensor that counts, and that's what I feel is lacking.  The batteries were also a pain. I would rather have a rechargeable battery that I can slide into an AC wall charger than have to worry about buying batteries all the time. With active use, the camera would like 1.5-2 weeks on a set of batteries.TL;DR - for $100, just spend a little more and get a better camera

Reviews.Title: Big Bang for your buck......
Reviews.Author: Mazgirl62
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! I take it with me everywhere, so I am able to capture the memories :) Pictures come out quite nice & it's a good size screen too. Very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: It it what it is...
Reviews.Author: K. Szeliga "kjszeliga"
Reviews.Content: It is what it is, a Canon low end camera that is as simple to use as it gets. Perfect for the novice and worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera for the money
Reviews.Author: hardinml
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my old point and shoot and to prevent the need to carry around my DSLR while on vacation.  It's pretty nice for the money, however, it doesn't have a lot of options that I found yet.  There are better cameras out there but only if you want to spend more money on them.  I like it for what it's for.

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Carl W. Grubbs
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift for my spouse who likes to take good but uncomplicated pictures.  She loves it because it is small enough to fit into her purse where it is readily available.  She also likes the quick readiness of the camera and its pretty ample zoom quality that enables her to get closeup or fairly distant shots very quickly.  She does not miss shots that she did with her older camera.A good little point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: good beginner camera
Reviews.Author: Shawnie Loo "Shawnie"
Reviews.Content: bought this for my 12 year old granddaughter, who is computer savy, she loves it and figured it out withen an hour.  great price and gift. Make sure you get a larger memory card for it so it holds more pictures and runs faster.

Reviews.Title: Durable Camera
Reviews.Author: buzzer
Reviews.Content: This is a fine camera for a teenage girl. We purchased this as a gift for our daughters birthday and it has held up very well to the challenge.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: wsk
Reviews.Content: My 11-year old daughter saved up her grass-cutting money and purchased this camera. It's perfect for her - easy to use, pretty intuitive, and a good value in terms of the features you get for the price. We'll be taking it on our beach vacation in a few days, so that will be a good test of battery life and durability. So far, she's been pretty satisfied with the pictures she's taken of the family dog, her sisters, and her friends. It might not be the best purchase if you need something for professional use or for heavy duty as the family camera, but it's perfect for the not-so-serious photog who just wants something that does the basic job for not a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: Canon A490 camera
Reviews.Author: Ray_TN
Reviews.Content: This Canon A490 was purchased as a gift for a not-very-technically-inclined adult relative.  He has been using an ancient (maybe 1980s?) Canon 35mm film rangefinder camera, which is about twice as wide, high, and deep as the A490, and probably 10 times heavier, but interestingly has most of the same features (zoom lens, auto-exposure, flash, general form factor) and buttons.  I recently helped him set the new one up; it was still in its box <g>.  I was taking initial pix in about 5 minutes; about half of that time was wrestling the bubble pack on the separately purchased SDHD memory card (no memory card comes with the camera).  Two alkaline AA batteries were included.  I formatted the card, and then took several indoor pix, with and without flash, in a pretty dimly lit room.  Quality, judged purely on the LCD screen, was acceptable, but definitely better with the flash (no surprise).  Recycle time of the flash was a bit long, even with new batteries.  I expect that it will worsen as the batteries weaken, like most such cameras.  I recommended that he get some of the newer (low self-discharge) NiMH rechargeable batteries.  Setting the camera features using the menu was pretty straightforward, even with no manual in hand, but I have set up quite a few digital cameras, so I had an advantage.  The camera seems a bit flimsy, but that may be just a feeling due to its extremely light weight and tiny size.  This really is a "shirt-pocket" camera (which was why I bought it for him; he travels a lot).  It has one interesting feature that can be turned on -- it enlarges the focus zone when the shutter is partially depressed, so you can better see how good the focus is, and the expressions on the subjects' faces.  The LCD screen is small but pretty sharp.  It looks about the same brightness and quality as most other LCD camera screens, so I expect it to be typically hard to see in bright sunlight.  The battery and memory card cover is typically flimsy -- why can't camera manufacturers make one of the most frequently used components a little sturdier?  The controls seem about as good as most other cameras; the 5-position control switch is tactile and somewhat recessed to reduce inadvertent operation, and the zoom works smoothly and easily.  The operating sound effects were pretty loud even at half-volume; I changed them to their lowest audible settings.  The camera CCD is reasonably high resolution (10 MP), and you can select the file sizes that you wish to record.  I set the camera for roughly 2 MB file sizes; it reported it could record roughly 2400 pix on the 4 GB memory card I installed.  I didn't try out the macro capability, but it exists.  I can't say anything yet about reliability, other than my previous comments about possibly flimsy areas.  My guess is that could be a factor for kids or ham-fisted adults.  The gold box deal price was excellent, so there's not a big worry about cost effectiveness.  Bottom line -- probably a good camera to have in your pocket or purse for brighter-than-twilight illuminated impulse shots.  Many similar cameras can get into trouble with dirt in the telescoping lens components, so it would probably be a good idea to keep it in a case or even just a zip-lock bag, to keep crud out of the mechanism.  Right now it seems like an OK purchase that will provide photos that my relative will be quite happy with.

Reviews.Title: Good as a 2nd camera for mobile purposes
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This camera is small and neat. Although it's a 10MP it doesn't shoot that clearly. The flash has to charge which is a bit frustrating since it means long waits between shots. Convenient to carrry around because of it's size, so it's great as a 2nd (in case of emergency) camera.

Reviews.Title: Basic but does the job
Reviews.Author: Joanna Daneman
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot has a lot of features and it's cheap. It does the job for a lot less than a c-note and is a good carry-with camera, better than a phone cam and can slip in a pocket easily.The deets: (spec)  10.0 megapixels and 3.3x optical zoom. Settings for all kinds of photo situations, flash.  13 predefined shooting situations such as bright sun, snow, etc. 2.5-inch LCD. Uses AA batteries. Video function available; you can do short films. There is a microphone for sound with your film.Surprisingly, for a cheap camera, there is a portrait shooting mode with Face Detection technology. The camera detects faces within the frame and  follows them, as long as they are in the frame and facing the camera.However, this camera has no viewfinder. You use the LCD to frame your shot, and that means in brilliant sunlight, you might not be able to see your shot before you snap. Also, it does NOT come with an SD card so you have to pick one up at the same time you buy the camera.At this price, this is a good choice for an entry-level camera, one for a trip where you are worried about losing a more expensive piece of equipment, or for kids. It doesn't feel particularly sturdy but it does the job.**Update As time goes on, I like this camera less and less. The screen is practically useless in bright light (you have to wear a ball cap or figure a way to shade the top.) The AA battery IS a nice feature--these are available even on the Moon it would seem, so you can always keep a spare set of AA's to make sure your camera is functional. The low light performance is very "meh." And there are newer cameras, for less, that have a better feel, more zoom (this is only 3.3x), front and back screens and Wifi. Canon optics are good, especially in small format, but this camera is not the sharpest one in the drawer and feels cheapish compared to newer models of point-and-shoot. I don't particularly enjoy using it--it's mostly the OMG I need an emergency camera better than my phone camera, and it also helps me keep a camera with me 24-7, which is how you can sometimes get "that shot" unless you're wearing your DSLR as a clothing accessory. Which, as a kid, I used to do. Back in the dark ages of developing my own film and no instant feedback "did I get the shot or not?" Let alone autofocus and in-camera metering.So, there are better choices: I'd look at some of the Samsungs with built-in Wifi; they have more megapixels and features, longer zoom and they actually cost less.For what I paid ($59), this is a good knock-about camera with a lot of features. It is not what I would call my working camera; this is the "throw in your bag" or "camping" camera if you are worried about your environment. Since this fits inside my MP3 player case, it's a handy take-along.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, if it's on sale
Reviews.Author: chemao
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived very well packaged and included a carry strap and batteries. It didn't come with a memory card, although I suppose this is par for the course these days. Also included were USB cables to connect to the computer with, and an audio/video cable that can be used to connect your camera to a television's RCA inputs. Finally, as assumed, there were several books of documentation and a CD with the Canon applications. Overall, the presentation was borderline overkill for a budget camera.The pictures are very clear, as expected from Canon. This is my 4th Canon digital camera (A60, S600, S1000, and now A490) I haven't yet taken any night pictures, so I can't comment on the flash, but in twilight conditions it did fine. I typically disable the digital zoom, although I did take a couple of pictures with it enabled just for testing. Obviously, there was a little clarity loss with the digital zoom compared to optical zoom, but it was definitely acceptable. Overall, I'm very pleased with the image quality.The overall build of the camera is definitely not what I've come to expect from Canon. It feels very plastic and flimsy, and reminds me of a disposable camera you'd buy at the pharmacy. The LCD screen, while large enough to preview your images (2.5 inch), lacks resolution and loses some detail. I should interject that the image itself is untarnished, and on your computer or printout will certainly be very nice. The camera is a larger than I had expected based on the product images on the Canon website - and perhaps that was their intent. Even the image of the camera on the box looks thin and sleek. If you look at it,  you would expect the camera to be the size of an S-series or digital ELPH. Alas, it's between those and the old A-series cameras. I'm lead to believe this might have been a packaging issue, since the camera uses AA batteries. While I'm not thrilled there isn't a rechargeable battery, I can definitely see the benefit of this if you're out sightseeing or at an activity and your battery runs out. I would be much more receptive to the AA battery idea if they had found a way to package the camera more tightly so it wasn't so thick.The MSRP on this camera is about $100. Honesly, I wouldn't pay $100 bucks for it. There are many nicer cameras with on the market for that price. I bought mine as a slick deal however, and paid only $50 + free shipping + free camera carry case.In conclusion, this is a fantastic camera IF you can get it on discount. I'd probably be willing to pay up to $65 for the camera, but not really much more than that. Keep in mind, for that price you'd be HARD PRESSED to find another camera that takes pictures as clear as this. Don't be fooled by the the 10 megapixel nonsense. Your Samsung camera with 12 megapixels won't take pictures as nice as this camera. Can I say it's like a Toyota Corolla? It's basically a really good car in a cheap case.

Reviews.Title: I love it anyway
Reviews.Author: Tutts
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a goldbox offer and love it for the most part. The picture quality is good enough for an amateur or for family use. I partnered it up with Transcend 8GB Class 10 SDHC Card and Flexible Leg Table top Tripod (fits like a glove) and 1,300mA Universal AC Adapter with Compatibility Tips and USB Power Port for home use or when I am taking pictures of my items for sale.Overall I do love the camera and my only hangup is the quality of the materials. If it had been made of more sturdy materials it would have received 5 stars from me.PROS:it was less than $50very easy to usedecent battery life (only needs 2, YAY!)sleek and pretty10 megapixelsCONS:Material is VERY, VERY, VERY CHEAPIts so light that I don't think it will survive a drop of any kind.

Reviews.Title: Definitely Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Stacey
Reviews.Content: Pros: light weight, easy to use, great detail in photos FOR THE PRICE. i'm comparing this to other cameras at this price, and i bought this on Amazon for $49.99, and i dont think i could have gotten a better deal. bear in mind i have only had this camera for a week so far, but i stil love it. i think it is great, i'm saving my money to buy a nice dslr, so to use this in the meantime is great, it is perfect.Cons: there was a couple things, you do have to be extreeemely still if theres a slow shutter speed, which is typical of most cameras, but just saying, with this camera, pictures with the flash don't look as great as the ones without. another thing, it randomly turns off when i am reviewing pictures and it is at the beginning / end of the list. i thought that was really strange, and its been doing that since out of the box, not sure if i should call someone about that.all in all, if you're short on cash and want a decent camera, this one is decent, and good for casual use. i would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, tough on batteries
Reviews.Author: Andy in Utah
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera with excellent picture quality for a point and shoot. My only problem is that when using flash, picture preview on the LCD, or recording video, it sucks the battery life quickly. If you buy this, invest in a brick of AA batteries too.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with camera.
Reviews.Author: Gonzalo Trevino "GT"
Reviews.Content: Satisfied with purchase of this Canon camera.  It's very basic, easy to use, small & light weight, and the picture quality is better than average.  I was looking for something like this so I didn't always have to carry around my bigger 35mm camera.

Reviews.Title: "used" camera
Reviews.Author: J. England
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived with secure packaging and very timely.  Batteries included were no good out of shelf life I think. The camera was listed as "used" meaning taken out of original package but everything was in order. I like the camera size, pictures are wonderful and instructions clear since this is my first digital camera and I am learning how to use it to the best advantage.

Reviews.Title: Digital Power
Reviews.Author: EBB
Reviews.Content: I am liking my new camera, the PowerShot A490 10.0 MP Digital with 3.3x Optical Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD.  The image window is much clearer and the picturesappear to be very good.  I am still getting used to it.  I need to spend moretime using it.  EBB

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: T. franzen
Reviews.Content: camera takes a long time to focus.  7 out of 10 pics are blurry unless you are very patient. the features are minimual and not very user friendly.  had this camera for less than 6 months and the battery compartment broke and unless it's taped the batteries fall to the floor.would not buy again.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Nana Conni "cj"
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is a nice little camera.  My son-in-law whose hobby is photography was really impressed with the quality of the pictures.  I wish the battery life was a little longer but I've learned to carry a spare . . . or two!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for a low price
Reviews.Author: jrbd
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for two weeks, and I'm almost completely satisfied.Good:Easy to use for basic point-and-shoot pictures and zoomingQuick to turn onPicture quality is goodNot so good:Several of our outdoor zoomed pictures had a noticable streak/lens flare if the camera was pointed in the same general direction as the sun.As with most digital cameras, the instructions are skimpy and the features are indicated by cryptic little icons.The screen seems fragile, although nothing has damaged it yet.  Maybe not a problem.Overall, not perfect, but quite worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Buy For A General Use Camera
Reviews.Author: Ann Hawkins
Reviews.Content: I bought this Canon camera many months ago for a surprisingly low price.  I used to be involved in photography & I had a top-of-the-line Canon camera that was great.  I no longer do any photography, but I occasionally need a camera for pictures to e-mail to friends, that sort of thing.  Since I loved my old Canon camera, I thought I'd buy this one.  Heck, I just love this camera.  I use it for general occasional use.  It's easy to operate and it takes a decent picture.

Reviews.Title: Great starter cam....
Reviews.Author: rammer
Reviews.Content: This camera takes some of the most awesome outdoor pics I have ever seen. Yes it takes 2 aa batteries  .

Reviews.Title: broke within 3 months
Reviews.Author: soltime
Reviews.Content: out of the blue, for no reason, this camera just decided it wouldn't work anymore.  I try to turn it on, it beeps loudly at me and I get an error message on the screen "Lens Error, Will shut down automatically, restart camera" after which I cannot do anything with the camera, and it shuts off.  the lens doesn't ever try to open.I had this camera for less than 3 months, and I did not damage it in any way.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it
Reviews.Author: Scott Mcconnell
Reviews.Content: This camera takes OK pics and videos. However, the battery door snap broke (as mentioned by at least one other reviewer), and I had to hold it closed with a rubber band thereafter - poor design. The biggest problem, however, was the battery life. With new copper top batteries, I'd get about 20 pics before the low battery warning symbol would appear. I recently had to use regular (non-copper top) batteries in a pinch, and after 3 pics the low battery symbol came on and the camera kept shutting down. I had this problem with my initial A490, so sent it back and received a refurbished one as a replacement, and have had the same problem. I definitely would not wish the purchase of this model on anyone else.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Brenda Marcenaro
Reviews.Content: I use this camera all of the time.  It is compact and produces great photos, it is easy to upload photos onto my computer.  I highly recommend it to anyone.  It travels well also because of its size.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for 40 dollars
Reviews.Author: Luiskill
Reviews.Content: Awesome for 40 dollars cant complain my mom needed a new camera she lost so i bought her a new one but worked awesome for everyday use

Reviews.Title: Good product for money
Reviews.Author: UJJVAL BHAGAT
Reviews.Content: It is acceptable quality camera but still not as good as other canon compact range camerasBut not bad for a good cheap price

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: Mix-in-it
Reviews.Content: Not a very good quality.  It broke after only 3 months and the picture quality was terrible and hard to install.  I did buy a better Cannon and spent a little more money on it.  I am glad I upgraded and didn't go cheap.  Guess you get what you pay for.  Never again.

Reviews.Title: Nice!!!
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: I purchased as a gift and my daughter loved it. It was exactly as described and will be used alot.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: jamie
Reviews.Content: i needed a cheap camera and after doing research on amazon i found this and really like it. it is easy to use and takes good pics. i have had a few fuzzy ones but for the price i could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: PIX
Reviews.Author: C Buehler
Reviews.Content: GOT THIS NOT KNOWING HOW IT WOULD DO.I HAVE BEEN USING CAMERA ON ALL OUR OCCASIONS, AND CRUISES.TAKES FANTASTIC PICTURES, AND HAS FEATURES OF OLD TIME FAVORITES TO SELECT.

Reviews.Title: Excelente cámara!
Reviews.Author: Reynaldo Miranda "REX"
Reviews.Content: Hola!Estoy gratamente complacido con esta cámara de Canon.  A la fecha, tengo más de un año con ella, y junto con "Sanyo Eneloop AA NiMH Pre-Charged Rechargable Batteries with Charger - 4 Pack", hacen un gran equipo.By the way, cuando la compré, aproveché el deal del día, a unos maravillosos $49.99!  =)

Reviews.Title: Poor quality manufacture
Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: I am on my second Power Shot A490, third if you count the original whos numbers I dont now recall. On each and every one of them within a few months of rather active picture taking it becomes impossible to squeeze the camera to take a darn picture without simultaneously squeezing open the battery door. And we all know what happens then....your picture is now LOST!!! I cant even set mine down on my desk without the battery door popping open. Really a poor design with poor quality that makes trying to take pictures and NOT loose either the shot or my expensive rechargeable batteries quite a struggle. Not to mention the same issues already discussed by others here. The separate battery for the date/time memory died within just a month and I have been unable to find one anywhere...and now have lost the original that I was toting around so have NO clue even what size it takes anymore (because this information is NOT in the owners manual), the flash recharge time is crazy long and here lately its a struggle to even make the flash work for me in the auto mode.It also seems to have lost its ability to focus properly in auto as well. Cheap and annoying camera!! I have always used Cannons and miss my old fashioned film badly....this is not helping!! Next purchase will be with someone else!!!!

Reviews.Title: Eh... entry level camera
Reviews.Author: Joshua J. Danziger
Reviews.Content: Lets see, I bought this camera at the end of 2010 and it still works, so that's a bonus. Lets take a look at some Pros.Pros-Good price-Battery life is decent-nice physical design and sleek-easy to use controls-good photos of still objectsCons-no Image stabilizer, makes blurry photos half of the time-Every time I turn it on I need to input the date, even when I replace ALL batteries-Flash take a very long time to charge-moving images blur... always...-Movies and sound don't always sync up the bestDo I regret buying the camera? No. But I got what I paid for. If I wanted a camera with the image stabilizer and good videos then I would have gotten a better camera. I wish I got a better camera, but for whats its worth, the A490 80 dollars, no more.

Reviews.Title: OK Camera
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: This is the camera I was expecting. Nothing too fancy, bulky or pricey. I bought this for the day to day, when hanging out with friends, for quick shots, etc. Picture quality is ok, though I would not use this to record a video, the quality is horrible. Only for pics. I like the design and that is not too heavy.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Shane Kesterke "mpeachbill"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera! I bought this camera Aug. 19, 2010 and it worked great for nearly a year then it had some problems, it still worked but I would have trouble turning it on, so I sent it back and got a new one free! The new one has been working great and I would certianly suggest this as a great camera to buy.

Reviews.Title: Great for children
Reviews.Author: dbarnard
Reviews.Content: This camera is by no means a 'great' or 'top-of-the-line' item. However, my 4 year old absolutely loves having his own camera. It often takes extremely blurry pictures, and if you are not in strong lighting, I would highly recommend using another camera, such as the one on your cell phone, prior to attempting to take a quality picture with this. Also, those with shaky hands should stay away from this item, as any movement during shutter is easily viewed in the pictures. Overall, if you're looking for a cheap, small camera for a child or someone with low expectations, this it your camera. However, if you're looking for a reliable camera to take quality pictures, spend a bit more and go with a Nikon Coolpix!!

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for the price (that I payed)
Reviews.Author: Sasha
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandma, because she kept using the same crappy camera for over 6 years. The main problem was that she wanted a new camera that was simple to use, and most camera's these days have too many functions for elderly people to understand. I chose this one because of its price, and because certain youtube videos demonstrated that the UI which was simple and clear.Pro'sThis camera uses AA batteries which are simple to find and easily rechargeableThe photo quality is very good under decent lightingThe video quality is OK, seeing as it is 640 by 480The UI is simple enough, however Canon still added those scene modes which I find are completely unnecessaryGreat value - the quality is very good for the priceConsFlash takes forever to recycleBuild is a bit cheapPhotos get easily overexposed when the camera is zoomed out for some reasonBottom lineWell, considering that I got this camera over a year ago for half the price that amazon currently sells it, I am very happy. It turned out to work just fine, and my grandma has more or less understood how to use it. The photos are of fairly high quality and they are very clear. The UI is mostly easy to use, however there are a couple of confusions: for example, when you push the Photo/Video button you get modes such as Program and Scene as well, which can confuse the inexperienced user. If I designed this camera, I would allow people to make this button to simply switch from video to photo mode and vice versa.

Reviews.Title: Canon Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: James Chaffin "Bachelor Cook"
Reviews.Content: I have been a film photographer for 30+ years.  The increased costs have forced this 75 year old man to look for a less expensive alternative.  I won't bore you with the technical specs, that I don't understand.  I do wish that the camera and memory card had been shipped together.  It was tough having to wait for the needed memory card to arrive by 'snail mail' while all I could do was read the user's manual for the camera.  Off hand, I will have a steep learning curve it seems.  This camera has little resemblance to my 35mm SLRs or 4x5 view cameras.  Hopefully this camera will make up for some of the lost enjoyment of photography.

Reviews.Title: Great buy and great gift
Reviews.Author: ChopShop
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift and the value was incredible :) :) :) Picture quality was good too. Reason for four stars is not a rechargable battery which kinda sucks. But otherwise....great point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: gtgirl
Reviews.Content: This camera is among the best I've owned, especially considering the price.  The pictures are bright and clear and the camera is easy to use.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at a good value
Reviews.Author: Jane L. Ticehurst "Janiegirl"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an extra - very easy to use and the pictures are great.  I like the fact that it runs on batteries.  My other camera has to have the battery charged.  It ran out the other day at the park.  Carrying a couple of batteries is easy.  Would definitely recommend it for standard pictures.

Reviews.Title: pretty decent for the price
Reviews.Author: 5fatbirds
Reviews.Content: i think a lot of reviewers are forgetting that they paid less than $100 for this camera- i didnt expect much going in, but it has pleasantly exceeded my expectations. i don't really bother with the scenery modes (except firework), since they actually make it harder to get a nice pic- i find myself relying on the manual/program mode, esp macro+vivid color balance, which for the most part yields amazingly clear, bright pics, enough to make some people ask me whether i used a dslr to take them. i agree that image stabilization would be appreciated, but again you could just use manual mode and set your own iso and such to make your pictures come out better. i find that taking pics with enough light in macro also eliminates most of the shutter lag from P&Ss;, which is great for action shots or if your subjects are fidgety. i also really like the delayed flash (also manual), which in some cases can give the feel of more natural lighting. as far as i can tell, the "low light" mode is terrible- just turn on a light/change up the settings. also, i'd suggest buying chargeable batteries to save on waste.one thing has worried me- i've had this camera for almost a year no problems, and all of a sudden the other day all my most recent pictures disappeared- i tried uploading them to my mac (which i have been doing, no problem), and only one showed up out of about 200. i thought it might be apple's fault, so i tried on the camera and just like that they were all gone. the strange thing is i had been playing the pics no problem, yet they were all gone after i turned off/on the camera again. i looked it up and it seems to be a recurring problem w/canon- i'm not sure who's at fault the card company or the camera one, but it'd be worth researching before you lose memories.

Reviews.Title: Nice~ does a great job for a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: sueribs
Reviews.Content: I got this Canon as a back up point and shoot until I get my dream camera, a few hundred dollars more.This one is compact, fits nicely in a pocket or purse, and takes a great picture-especially for the average photographer or one who doesn't need anything more than an automatic, good photo.Sometimes if it isn't liking the lighting or framing it will actually refuse to take the picture, which could be annoying if you are in a hurry! Once it told me no(I know, crazy huh?) when the flash button was off and I forgot to turn it on.I love the results, so all's well on that front-clear pictures, good quality and nice zoom.I got it on a special 50% off day, so $50. was worth it.I use my cameras often, so got myself a rechargeable  and recharger for $11. at Target and it uses 2 AA batteries.It holds the charge a decent amount of time, then when you zoom alot it will say 'recharging' and it again takes a minute longer.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin B.
Reviews.Content: It has proven to be a good little camera, worthy of it's price. It has traveled well, takes a reasonably good picture for most uses and I would recommend it to family. Not like the Nikon I bought previously to this one that was a complete piece of #$%$. I had to send in for repair under warranty, got it back and it failed again within 6 months (same problem). Will stick with Canon.

Reviews.Title: A very good camera
Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: For the price, it's a very good product. It's very light and easy to use, I recomend it for home photos.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: This camera was so easy to set up and start taking pictures.  Takes wonderful pictures.  I am compelely happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A490
Reviews.Author: EH
Reviews.Content: So far, I've been very pleased with this camera. It doesn't offer a ton of different options, but is very user-friendly and a great buy for the price!

Reviews.Title: Good stuff for $50
Reviews.Author: Duy Dang
Reviews.Content: Every thing is fine, for a point and shoot cam. Photo quality is excellent. Good light sensitivity (can take indoor pics with confident).The only thing that cause little annoyance is the responsiveness. You have to wait 2-3s, after your click, for the picture to save in memory card.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A490
Reviews.Author: Perky
Reviews.Content: I've only my camera for weeks but the little time that I ve had it, it appears to be wonderful

Reviews.Title: GREAT value!
Reviews.Author: klarcr
Reviews.Content: Love the Canon Powershot line!  Designed well with quality and features.  Additionally, this camera was offered on sale and I scored a great deal, including a free Lowepro case for it.  Can't beat dealing with Amazon.com as well!  THANKS

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Ron Diefenthaler
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter to take to camp.  I had purchased less expensive one ($50 +/-), but the picture quality was terrible.  The camera is well built and the photos are fantastic.FOLLOW-UP: a little over a year later the view finder broke. I like Cannon products but stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: You don't get what you pay for ... you get more.
Reviews.Author: Arctic runner
Reviews.Content: For what I paid ( less than $60 ) this is really hard to beat ... I read some of the reviews and some of the authors need to be a little more realistic. It takes great photos , is light and travels well, simple timer, and is easy to use . I will grab this without hesitation in many situations where I do not want to lug my bigger Nikon around. No problems with it so far. The best pictures are the ones taken... if your leaving your camera at home because its too heavy or too " expensive " this is a great option...

Reviews.Title: Doesn't deliver
Reviews.Author: T. Greenwood "Tom"
Reviews.Content: Only 1 in 5 shot are in focus with this camera, don't waste your money. I owned a lot of cameras, but this is the first one that just doesn't focus. 80% of my shots are out of focus. No other camera has given me this much problem just trying to get an in focus shot.

Reviews.Title: Well...
Reviews.Author: E. HESSE
Reviews.Content: This camera takes GORGEOUS pictures, however, the battery life REALLY SUCKS!!!  I bought the camera as a gift and my mom loves it, however, she says, "I have to carry about 50 batteries when I go out".  That part of it is sad...however, the pictures come out amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: Good Starter Digital Camera for Kids or Seniors
Reviews.Author: L. Shoaf
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive plastic encases the camera but the picture quality makes up for it.No special battery charger is needed.  The camera utilizes common AA batteries.This camera is intuitive and simple to use.I bought it for my 80-year old mother as a starter camera.  Would be a good camera for kids, too.

Reviews.Title: great camera at a good price
Reviews.Author: DianeLyn
Reviews.Content: I haven't used the camera very much yet so I'm still learning.  I just wanted something to take pictures,no bells and whistles.  Consumer's Report recommended this model so I'm giving it a try.  Seller packaged camera very well.

Reviews.Title: Slow Slow Slow
Reviews.Author: just me
Reviews.Content: I thought the quality was ok but it was so slow that I had to take it back.  I would take a photo then wait wait wait while the screen says "busy".  aaaaah!

Reviews.Title: The worst PowerShot I've owned
Reviews.Author: Jodie M. Marsilio "JoJo"
Reviews.Content: This is probably the 4th PowerShot I've owned and I HATE it!!  I swear like a truck driver every time I use it..  it takes HORRIBLE pictures unless the object you are taking a picture of is perfectly still...  my 3 kids are not that subject..  NOT a good pick if you want pics of the kids doing things, can't even get an acceptable pic if they are sitting..  I've had this for about 6 months and I'm already replacing it..  I'm getting another Cannon bc I love them..  this was a bad choice

Reviews.Title: Never underestimate this camera's performance by its low price.
Reviews.Author: H. Ma
Reviews.Content: The irony in the camera's world is the cheaper the camera, the better the picture quality.  This is true at least in my case.  For years I've owned the following cameras in the order of their prices:Canon A490 ($95)  (5 stars)Canon Xsi ($612) (5 stars)Canon T2i ($849) (4 stars)Nikon D70 ($1,000) (4 stars)Canon 50D ($1,110) (3 stars)Unfortunately, the order of the picture quality is just the opposite---Canon A490 being the best (5-star) and Canon 50D being the worst.You can never complain anything about A490.  Too bad I can't post here stunningly beautiful pictures taken with my A490 that I recently purchased from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Adequate Camera, Excellent Price
Reviews.Author: FA user
Reviews.Content: This is a good basic camera for the price. The picture quality and battery life are only ok, but this is a solid camera for people who aren't power users.

Reviews.Title: Bought this camera to beat the crap out of it.
Reviews.Author: VRG Matt
Reviews.Content: And it didn't disappoint. This camera survived me from July 2010 to November 2010 before major malfunction. In that time period (though relatively short) I've captured roughly 5000 photos. I work as a outdoor guide in the desert southwest and needed this sucker for work and for personal use. Its lifespan was 100% outdoor desert environment. I've used it in light rain, wet and muddy canyons, arid-dry-sandy-30mph+ wind gusts, in cold and heat, and just about everything else the desert could throw my way. There was even the rare 3-4ft drop here and there, but I treated it pretty good in my opinion. The malfunction I speak of is the lens. It extends and retracts but will not open. It kind of built up to this scenario where I'd have to used a finger nail to open the lens certain times like two or three weeks before full on fingernail trick not even working.Also, you're getting a $90 dollar camera. It's what it is. Construction is mostly lightweight plastic... pics won't win any awards. But... if your like me and need something that can do pics and videos for a cheap price on a piece of gear that you know no matter how much money you dropped on it (I could have bought a $400 camera) really won't improve the survivability of the device for the kind of use I required, it won't disappoint.I'm buying another one but getting a warranty for what I now accept as the inevitable.

Reviews.Title: works only on flash
Reviews.Author: SimuFan "Sim"
Reviews.Content: without flash, picture and video quality is very poor, video is dull, picture colors get off, forget about taking a picture of none-still person. the picture size is big but it doesn't guaranty good quality.the picture quality is good with the flash, but it doesn't last long, the "Charging the flash" message between pictures appeared after 20 shots on a new pair of battery.

Reviews.Title: great customer service
Reviews.Author: rhird
Reviews.Content: This company has great customer service.  We are so impressed with how they have handled our order!  We would purchase from this company again.

Reviews.Title: Broke within 2 days
Reviews.Author: flatmr
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday purchase for my 8 year old son. The lens retraction stopped working within 2 days. I wouldn't recommend buying it.

Reviews.Title: Seriously, spend a little more for a better camera!
Reviews.Author: Makeupqueen
Reviews.Content: My cheap skate dad bought this simply because it was cheap. I was pretty mad considering I used to do photography and has about 3 old point and shoot sitting around that I could have given to him.Anyways, when i first handled this camera, I was amazed at how badly made it was. It felt like one of those digital cameras you see at those little stands by some tourist attraction. The only people who would buy are who either forgot to bring their camera or their camera ran out of battery so they had to buy these cheap almost disposable camera so they will have pictures. Here is my advice, DO NOT be FOOLED by the megapixels. If you are a casual camera taker, you have no need for huge megapixels and seriously for a causal point and shoot situations, a 7 megapixel is not that much difference in image quality than a 12 megapixel. You will not notice the difference.Heck, I have a 6.1 megapixel super-zoom camera I bought for $230 5 years ago ( they are probably only $100) that I am still using and has features almost like a SLR.So spend a little more, it can go a long way! also buy one with rechargeable batteries! You will get your money back within a year!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Camera A490
Reviews.Author: Ajax369
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed. The camera did NOT come with a memory card nor did it have the hand strap or a battery. I had hoped that the Canon PowerShot A490 camera would come ready to use or at least need a battery. For a month now, the camera has been idle because I have not had the time to shop for a memory card and hand strap. Since there was no memory card and no battery, I cannot evaluate the performance of the camera. This was a disappointing purchase for me.

Reviews.Title: NEEDS A MEMORY CARD
Reviews.Author: C. Regan "book worm"
Reviews.Content: Okay, I may be the only ignorant buyer here but why or why would this camera not come with a "required" item.  Sure, they gave me two double A batteries because I really need them but hey, don't try to take a picture unless you purchased a memory card which is sold separately.  How about you include the memory card and leave out the batteries?  I can always find two double A batteries around the house.  I'm rating this product three stars just in case I really am the only ignorant buyer here!

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: R. Elliott
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Canon Powershot A490 from Go4compters because I had read a good review on the product, Go4compters sent me an 'upgrade' Canon Powershot A495. I would have liked some input as to if I wanted a different model. It worked for about 10 days and then would turn on and then immediately turn off. I contacted the Go4compters to return it ($16 for shipping). I received a notice that they were sending me another 'upgrade', but this time they sent my original order, the A490. Within the week the new camera was doing the same thing. I contacted Go4computers again, they said contact Canon and let them know what Canon says. I have asked for my money back, but have received no reply.Canon PowerShot A490 10.0 MP Digital Camera with 3.3x Optical Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD

Reviews.Title: Where's the Memory???
Reviews.Author: Roger Nobles "aka Fynn McKewl"
Reviews.Content: Nice to hold, easy setup, very readable user manual, but no memory??? Even though I did order a memory card at the same time, Amazon doesn't stock it, so the memory is shipped by another party, non-expedited and at additional expense, totally negating the $.90 savings on the camera. a memory card of some capacity should be included with camera purchase so it can be used right out of the package.

ProductInfo.Features:
10.0 megapixels and 3.3x optical zoom make picture taking a snap
Smart AUTO intelligently selects from 13 predefined shooting situations; Low Light mode enables great shots in dim lighting
Large, clear 2.5-inch LCD
AA battery power enables you to easily power up on the go
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Canon PowerShot A490 10.0 MP Digital Camera with 3.3x Optical Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD
